com.password4j

Class HashChecker<C extends HashChecker<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.password4j.HashChecker<C>
  • Type Parameters:
    C - extends HashChecker.

    public class HashChecker<C extends HashChecker<?>>
extends Object
    Builder class that helps to create a chain of parameters to be used in the verification process.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    David Bertoldi

    • Method Detail

      • addPepper

        public C addPepper(String pepper)
        Concatenates the provided string with the plain text password. The produced sequence (in the form pepper+password) is processed by the algorithm.
        Parameters:
        pepper - cryptographic pepper
        Returns:
        this builder
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • addPepper

        public C addPepper()
        Concatenates the pepper configured in your `psw4j.properties` file with the plain text password. The produced sequence (in the form pepper+password) is processed by the algorithm.
        Returns:
        this builder
        See Also:
        PepperGenerator.get()

      • addSalt

        public C addSalt(String salt)
        Add a cryptographic salt in the verifying process. The salt is applied differently depending on the chosen algorithm.
        Parameters:
        salt - cryptographic salt
        Returns:
        this builder
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • with

        public boolean with(HashingFunction hashingFunction)
        Check if the previously given hash was produced from the given plain text password with a specific implementation of HashingFunction.

        This method does not read the configurations in the `psw4j.properties` file.

        Parameters:
        hashingFunction - a CHF
        Returns:
        true if the hash was produced by the given plain text password; false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • withPBKDF2

        public boolean withPBKDF2()
        Check if the previously given hash was produced from the given plain text password with PBKDF2Function.

        This method read the configurations in the `psw4j.properties` file. If no configuration is found, then the default parameters are used.

        Returns:
        true if the hash was produced by the given plain text password; false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        AlgorithmFinder.getPBKDF2Instance()

      • withCompressedPBKDF2

        public boolean withCompressedPBKDF2()
        Check if the previously given hash was produced from the given plain text password with CompressedPBKDF2Function.

        This method read the configurations in the `psw4j.properties` file. If no configuration is found, then the default parameters are used.

        Returns:
        true if the hash was produced by the given plain text password; false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        AlgorithmFinder.getCompressedPBKDF2Instance()

      • withSCrypt

        public boolean withSCrypt()
        Check if the previously given hash was produced from the given plain text password with SCryptFunction.

        This method read the configurations in the `psw4j.properties` file. If no configuration is found, then the default parameters are used.

        Returns:
        true if the hash was produced by the given plain text password; false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        AlgorithmFinder.getSCryptInstance()

      • withBCrypt

        public boolean withBCrypt()
        Check if the previously given hash was produced from the given plain text password with BCryptFunction.

        This method read the configurations in the `psw4j.properties` file. If no configuration is found, then the default parameters are used.

        Returns:
        true if the hash was produced by the given plain text password; false otherwise.
        Since:
        1.0.0
        See Also:
        AlgorithmFinder.getBCryptInstance()
